contextId.information: It is understood that Shammah passed by Samuel. AT: "Jesse then made Shammah pass before Samuel" or "Jesse then told Shammah to go to Samuel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: Jesse then made Shammah pass by

contextId.information: It is understood that they were waiting to sit down and eat. AT: "we will not sit down to eat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The verb may be supplied from the previous line. AT: "and David has killed his ten thousands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The verb for the second phrase may be supplied from the first. AT: "The king does not desire any dowry; he desires only that you bring to him 100 foreskins" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: The king does not desire any dowry, only one hundred foreskins

contextId.information: This can be translated as a complete sentence. AT: "Your men may eat it if they have not slept with women recently" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: if the young men have kept themselves from women

contextId.information: You may make clear the understood information. AT: "sent men to speak to Abigail and tell her that David wanted to take her to be his wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: sent and spoke to Abigail, to take her to himself as wife
